perturbation.original_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.changed_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 30 days from the date of the invoice, regardless of when client payment is received by COMPANY.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies payment 'NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.' The modified text changes this to 'NET 30 days from the date of the invoice, regardless of when client payment is received by COMPANY.' This creates a contradiction because Bravatek's payment is now tied to the invoice date, not the client's payment to COMPANY, potentially requiring COMPANY to pay Bravatek before receiving payment themselves. This creates uncertainty and a potential dispute.

perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement is twelve (12) months from the date hereof, and will be automatically renewed for one (1) additional twelve month period unless either party shall notify the other in writing of its intention not to renew. Such notice must be given ninety (90) days prior to expiration of the original term. This Agreement may also be terminated by either party upon ninety (90) days written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement is twelve (12) months from the date hereof, and will be automatically renewed for one (1) additional twelve month period unless either party shall notify the other in writing of its intention not to renew. Such notice must be given ninety (90) days prior to expiration of the original term. This Agreement may also be terminated by either party upon thirty (30) days written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the agreement can be terminated with ninety (90) days written notice. The modified text changes this to thirty (30) days written notice. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the notice period required for termination, leading to potential disputes about the proper procedure for ending the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of COMPANY or breach of COMPANY of any of its obligations under this Agreement.

Bravatek shall indemnify COMPANY, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs, incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of Bravatek or breach of Bravatek of any of its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of COMPANY or material breach of COMPANY of any of its obligations under this Agreement.

Bravatek shall indemnify COMPANY, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs, incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of Bravatek or breach of Bravatek of any of its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires COMPANY to indemnify Bravatek for 'negligence or intentional misconduct'. The modified text changes this to 'gross negligence or willful misconduct' for COMPANY, while keeping 'negligence or intentional misconduct' for Bravatek's indemnity obligation. This creates an inconsistency as COMPANY is held to a higher standard (gross negligence/willful misconduct) for indemnification, while Bravatek is held to a lower standard (simple negligence/intentional misconduct), causing ambiguity and potentially unfair allocation of risk.
